channel.title: Server-Ending Error
channel.description:
Okay, here's the problem. I'm not sure if it's the system I'm running the files on or what, but everytime I make a server this is what happens: [code] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "4 156 2829" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at ObjectHandler.loadObjects(ObjectHandler.java:187) at ObjectHandler.<init>(ObjectHandler.java:51) at server.main(server.java:116) [/code]
Or something along those lines.
The weird thing is I don't even do anything! Everytime that's happened I've Ctrl + Z'ed many times to undo any mistakes I did, and that doesn't help. Could the program be doing something on its own?
I'm running on Vista.
NOTE: This happens at random times after I make the server. I could set my restarter on, get off the computer and go to sleep, wake up and then there's that error without any changes from me!
OTHER NOTE: This happens in runserver.bat, not the compiler.
Does anybody know how to fix this or what might be going wrong?
Thanks in advance, Zach

item.title: Server-Ending Error
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“LeScape, post:9, topic:199454”]Yup, you used spaces instead of tabs in a .cfg file. When anyone interacts with that asset in the .cfg file, a runtime error will appear.[/quote]Ah okay…

Just so you know I’m not a total noob I’ll tell you how that happened. xD

I am a noob for not knowing that spaces and tabs are different though. o.O

I made a C++ program yesterday and made them spaces instead of tabs between the numbers when it writes into object.cfg xD

Read full topic

item.title: Server-Ending Error
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

Yup, you used spaces instead of tabs in a .cfg file. When anyone interacts with that asset in the .cfg file, a runtime error will appear.

Read full topic

item.title: Server-Ending Error
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:1, topic:199457”]You used spaces instead of tabs.[/quote]Lol you were right… Wow such a small and unnoticeable error makes a big difference. xD

Read full topic

item.title: Server-Ending Error
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Haha cool…

Okay. Sorry I didn’t really look at the error to see what it was, as if I’ve just stopped caring what it says because this is probably the fifth time this has happened… >.<

return false; } while ((EndOfFile == false) && (line != null)) { line = line.trim(); int spot = line.indexOf("="); if (spot > -1) { token = line.substring(0, spot); token = token.trim(); token2 = line.substring(spot + 1); token2 = token2.trim(); token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token3 = token2_2.split("\t"); if (token.equals("object")) { server.objects.add(new Object(Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), Integer.parseInt(token3[1]), Integer .parseInt(token3[2]), Integer .parseInt(token3[3]))); } } else { if (line.equals("[ENDOFOBJECTLIST]")) { try { characterfile.close(); } catch (IOException ioexception) { } return true; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Server-Ending Error
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

LIKE WOA, your name is Zach too? You even spell it the same 0.0 I gotta help you now. Ok, look at the error itself.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.[b]NumberFormatException: For input string: "4 156 2829"[/b] at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) [b]at ObjectHandler.loadObjects(ObjectHandler.java:187)[/b] at ObjectHandler.(ObjectHandler.java:51) at server.main(server.java:116)
In other words, show me lines 170 - 200 in your ObjectHandler =]

Read full topic

@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Basically it ruins my server everytime it comes up and I have to start over.

Also, it usually comes up when I start runserver.bat, not while it’s running.

item.title: Server-Ending Error
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Okay, here’s the problem. I’m not sure if it’s the system I’m running the files on or what, but everytime I make a server this is what happens:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "4
156   2829"
        at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source)
        at ObjectHandler.loadObjects(ObjectHandler.java:187)
        at ObjectHandler.<init>(ObjectHandler.java:51)
        at server.main(server.java:116)

Or something along those lines.

The weird thing is I don’t even do anything! Everytime that’s happened I’ve Ctrl + Z’ed many times to undo any mistakes I did, and that doesn’t help. Could the program be doing something on its own?

I’m running on Vista.

NOTE: This happens at random times after I make the server. I could set my restarter on, get off the computer and go to sleep, wake up and then there’s that error without any changes from me!

OTHER NOTE: This happens in runserver.bat, not the compiler.

Does anybody know how to fix this or what might be going wrong?

Thanks in advance,
